Texts.Chs: 我觉得她误解了我的意思，我忐忑地望着她那如同红宝石般的眼眸，却又无法辩解。
Texts.Eng: I assume that she misunderstood the implication of my remark, but I cannot help stare a little too long into her triumvirate of ruby red eyes.

Texts.Chs: “这难道和你所认为的艺术标准不一样吗？嗯？”，她平静地说道。其实，我觉得这张照片并不好笑。
Texts.Eng: "...I guess the standard of art is different in your time, huh?" she says flatly. I presume that the picture was not, in fact, a joke.

Texts.Chs: “你的名字真奇怪。”，她淡然说道，“为什么你的父母会打电话给你？”
Texts.Eng: "...That's a weird name," she says flatly. "Why would your parents even call you that?"

Texts.Chs: “一首有趣的歌？好啊，我真想听听它到底有多有趣。”
Texts.Eng: "A fun song? That sounds... Fine. What kind of characters would it have?"

Texts.Chs: “听听这首，多么浪漫的旋律，多么美妙的节奏！你觉得怎样？”
Texts.Eng: "A romantic song! How wonderful! What should it be about?"

Texts.Chs: “一只悲伤的熊？呃，为什么这只熊会悲伤？”
Texts.Eng: "A sad bear? Um, okay. Why is the bear sad?"

Texts.Chs: “听一条鱼说笑话？这本身就是一个笑话，对了，那条鱼后来怎么样了？”
Texts.Eng: "A talking fish sounds fun. What should the fish be doing?"

Texts.Chs: “空气曲棍球？这是什么意思？”
Texts.Eng: "Air Hockey? What is this 'Air Hockey'? you speak of?"

Texts.Chs: “不过...”，她把注意力集中于她手中的法杖上说道，“或许这个仪式可以帮助你返回你的世界。”
Texts.Eng: "But perhaps..." she says whilst looking intently at the staff in her hand, "Perhaps finishing the ceremony will help send you back?"

Texts.Chs: “你能告诉我那是什么吗？”，她看上去很感兴趣。
Texts.Eng: "Can you tell what it is?" she asks, eagerly.

Texts.Chs: “你说的‘曲棍球’，别人是不是都喜欢玩这个？”
Texts.Eng: "Does this 'Air Hockey' of yours usually send people through time?"

Texts.Chs: “他失去了他的房子？噢，这太悲伤了！我突然对这首歌有了不同的看法，不过这并不有趣。”，她说道。
Texts.Eng: "He's losing his house? How sad! I have a song idea, but it isn't very funny." she says.

Texts.Chs: “我好喜欢它的旋律，我觉得我可以唱唱看。”，她说道。
Texts.Eng: "How adorable! I think I can sing about this." she says.

Texts.Chs: “多么好听的歌儿，我想唱这一首。”，她说道。
Texts.Eng: "How wholesome! I think I can sing about this." she says.

Texts.Chs: “我是霞，我是在下周为大塔图书馆开幕仪式祈福的巫女。”她说道。
Texts.Eng: "I am Kasumi, a shrine maiden sent to bless the Grand Hylotl Library before its opening next week." She explains.

Texts.Chs: “我现在可以画出来了！为什么他会相思成疾？”
Texts.Eng: "I can picture it now! Why is he so lovesick?"

Texts.Chs: “我不知道！” 她哭了出来。我感觉有什么东西在拉我。是一只不可见的命运之手。我突然意识到我在这里的时间很快就会结束。
Texts.Eng: "I don't know!" she cries out. I feel something tugging at me. An unseen hand of fate. I suddenly realise my time here may be over shortly.

Texts.Chs: “我完成了！”她宣布道。 她的笑容在夕阳中闪闪发光，就像美丽的琵琶鱼头上的诱饵一样。
Texts.Eng: "I have finished!" she announces. Her smile glitters in the sunset like the lure of a beautiful angler fish.

Texts.Chs: “如果你以不寻常的速度穿越时空，那你又认为是什么导致你来到这里？”
Texts.Eng: "If you have been sent through time and space at an unusual rate, what do you think caused you to come here?"

Texts.Chs: “很高兴见到你，沃恩·圣洛夫卡斯尔！”她笑着说。“在这么多地方之中您为什么独对这座未开馆的图书馆感兴趣呢？”
Texts.Eng: "It's a pleasure to meet you, Vaughn St. Lovecastle!" she says with a pleasant smile. "Why are you interested in this unopened library, of all places?"

Texts.Chs: 孤独的章鱼，他疲惫不堪，因为他迷恋的，与他天差地别。
Texts.Eng: "Lone Octopus, hesong fatigued, because his crush, is out of his league."

Texts.Chs: “孤独的章鱼，若你渴求约会，你不能坐以待毙，要付诸努力。”
Texts.Eng: "Lone Octopus, you can't just wait, put in some effort, if you want to date."

Texts.Chs: “当我为这座岛祈福的时候，其他人不该在这里！你为什么会来这里？”
Texts.Eng: "No-one else is supposed to be here whilst I bless the island! Why did you come here?"

Texts.Chs: “任何人都不该在这里！你为什么会来这里？”
Texts.Eng: "No-one else is supposed to be here, though! Why did you come here?"

Texts.Chs: “好吧，我想我有些东西...”
Texts.Eng: "Okay, I think I have something..." she says.

Texts.Chs: “可能是什么别的东西？”她若有所思...
Texts.Eng: "Perhaps it was something else?" she says thoughtfully..

Texts.Chs: “可怜又孤独的章鱼！我的脑海里响起了一首歌”她说
Texts.Eng: "Poor lonely octopus! I have a song in mind just for this." she says.

Texts.Chs: “悲伤的老熊，注定的漫游，走过了河畔，回到了老家”
Texts.Eng: "Sad old bear, destined to roam, after the banks, repossessed his home."

Texts.Chs: “悲伤的老熊，失败的前行，当你回过头，已成一首歌”
Texts.Eng: "Sad old bear, it's all gone wrong, since you realised, you're just a song."

Texts.Chs: “那么，告诉我”。她说，“在这么多地方之中你为什么只对这座未开馆的图书馆感兴趣呢？”
Texts.Eng: "So tell me," she begins, " Why are you interested in this unopened library, of all places?"

Texts.Chs: “海星恋人，如此甜蜜，无腿无足，如何起舞？”
Texts.Eng: "Starfish lovers, oh so sweet, how do you dance, without some feet?"

Texts.Chs: “海星恋人，心心相依，社团相见，飞梭共舞”
Texts.Eng: "Starfish lovers, united hearts, met at the youth club, playing darts."

Texts.Chs: “会说话的，强健的鱼，是什么让你的旅途如此精彩？”
Texts.Eng: "Talking fish, of utmost health, what makes you journey, for such wealth?"

Texts.Chs: “会说话的鱼，从我的梦中出现，我们该怎样，阻止你的尖叫？”
Texts.Eng: "Talking fish, straight from my dreams, how can we, prevent your screams?"

Texts.Chs: “这太悲哀了！我的脑海中响起了一首歌。”，她说。
Texts.Eng: "That is quite tragic! I have a song in mind just for this." she says.

Texts.Chs: “听起来很棒！那会是怎样的一种歌曲呢？”
Texts.Eng: "That sounds good! What kind of song should it be, then?"

Texts.Chs: “这有点奇怪，我们彼此都不太了解！”她回答到。我几乎没有时间去表达我的反对， 与此同时熟悉的时间拖拽感来袭，所有的东西都变得模糊。
Texts.Eng: "That's a bit weird, we don't know either other that well!" she responds. I barely have time to process my rejection as I feel the familiar tug of time, and everything fades.

Texts.Chs: “真可爱，他们在哪里相见的？”
Texts.Eng: "That's cute! Where did they meet?"

Texts.Chs: “对！”她说，“在那等着，等我完事了你就知道我的作品值不值了。”
Texts.Eng: "That's right!" she says. "Wait here, and when I'm done, you can judge if my art is worthy."

Texts.Chs: “真可爱，他们在哪里相见的？”
Texts.Eng: "The ceremony!" she exclaims. "But it is a ceremony of tradition, not divine power. And it is not even finished, either."

Texts.Chs: “时间...旅行？”她困惑的重复道，“但是，不是每个人都可以穿越时间吗？”
Texts.Eng: "Travelled... Through time?" she repeats, confused. "But doesn't everyone travel through time?"

Texts.Chs: “我们都已穿越了时空，速度大概是每秒1秒左右”她详细说明道
Texts.Eng: "We're all moving through time, at a rate of around 1 second per second." she elaborates.

Texts.Chs: “开始是‘祈祷的贡献’，然后是‘天才的贡献’，然后是‘歌曲的贡献’”
Texts.Eng: "Well first was the 'tribute of prayer' - next comes the 'tribute of talent', and then the 'tribute of song'."

Texts.Chs: “当然不是，我被你的手忙脚乱大叫着求助打断了”
Texts.Eng: "Well of course it isn't - I was interrupted by you flailing about and screaming for help."

Texts.Chs: “当然不是，我被你的手忙脚乱大叫着求助打断了”
Texts.Eng: "Well of course it isn't - I was interrupted by you flailing about screaming for help."

Texts.Chs: “失礼了，”她突然说道，“我忘了问你的名字了，你叫什么？”
Texts.Eng: "Where are my manners," she adds suddenly, "I forgot to ask you your name. Who are you?"

Texts.Chs: “失礼了，”她突然说道，“我叫霞，你的名字是？”
Texts.Eng: "Where are my manners," she adds suddenly, "My name is Kasumi. And who might you be?"

Texts.Chs: “你是谁，为什么像个呆子一样尖叫？”那个女孩说道，她那湿漉漉的美丽皮肤上的光芒在翩翩起舞
Texts.Eng: "Who are you, and why are you screaming like a nerd?" says the girl, light dancing off her beautiful, clammy skin.

Texts.Chs: “你是谁？为什么在这附近鬼鬼祟祟？”，那个女孩说道，她那湿漉漉的美丽皮肤上的光芒在翩翩起舞
Texts.Eng: "Who are you, and why are you sneaking around?" says the girl, light dancing off her beautiful, clammy skin.

Texts.Chs: “为什么，谢谢你！”她面带笑容的说。
Texts.Eng: "Why, thank you!" she says with a beaming smile.

Texts.Chs: “大喊大叫？当然。事实上，我想我有些东西...”
Texts.Eng: "Yelling? Sure. In fact, I think I have something..." she says.

Texts.Chs: “哈！就是这！”
Texts.Eng: "Yep! Here it is!"

Texts.Chs: “当我展示给你的时候你就会看到，现在！”
Texts.Eng: "You'll be able to see when I show you, riiiight now!".

Texts.Chs: “你现在在大塔图书馆，本图书馆从今晚起开放一周”她解释到。
Texts.Eng: "You're at the Grand Hylotl Library, which is opening one week from tonight." She explains.

Texts.Chs: “你说的话很牵强，洛夫卡斯尔先生”她说，“但你看起来不像我认识的任何人，可能你说的是真的。”
Texts.Eng: "Your story is far-fetched, Mr. Lovecastle," she begins, "But you don't look or talk like anyone I've ever known. Perhaps your story is true."

Texts.Chs: “你说的话很疯狂，”她说，“但你看起来不像我认识的任何人，可能你说的是真的。”
Texts.Eng: "Your story sounds insane," she begins, "But you don't look or talk like anyone I've ever known. Perhaps your story is true."

Texts.Chs: 一首有趣的歌
Texts.Eng: A fun song!

Texts.Chs: 相思成病的章鱼
Texts.Eng: A lovesick octopus!

Texts.Chs: 一首浪漫的歌
Texts.Eng: A romantic song!

Texts.Chs: 悲伤的熊！
Texts.Eng: A sad bear!

Texts.Chs: 令人作呕的，可怕的爱情史诗
Texts.Eng: A sickening, creepy love epic

Texts.Chs: 一条会说话的鱼！
Texts.Eng: A talking fish!

Texts.Chs: 一个青年俱乐部！
Texts.Eng: A youth club!

Texts.Chs: 说真的，我认为这种改变更多体现在于眼睛。他似乎可以无时无刻地监视你，探寻你的内心。他曾在背地里辱骂多克，这在以前，这是不可能会发生的。
Texts.Eng: Actually, I think it may be in the eyes. It's almost as if he sees you and...knows you. Knows you in ways he shouldn't. He remarked on Doakes's sordid past, and he wasn't there.

Texts.Chs: 仿佛过了千年之久，又如只过了五六分钟，我在开始的地方醒来了。
Texts.Eng: After what feels like a millenia, but also only maybe five or six minutes, I wake up where I began.

Texts.Chs: 某种外星人？
Texts.Eng: An alien of some kind?
An ethereal light suddenly fills the area as her words of power leave her lips. My stomach churns like a washing machine left out in the sun.
An unfamiliar land, a pounding headache... I decide to approach this situation with stealth. I crouch low, making my way across the beach towards the pagoda.
But at least I'll have my games.

Texts.Chs: 能给我看看吗？
Texts.Eng: Can I see?
Could she truly love me? Will she be able to come to the present with me? Will that cause a rift in the space-time continuum?

Texts.Chs: 大喊救命
Texts.Eng: Cry for help

Texts.Chs: 还好我足够谨慎，发现了一封粘在废墟外的信。这封信看起来非常陈旧，它一直在这里吗？
Texts.Eng: Curiously enough, I see a letter, sticking out of the rubble. It looks old, very old. Has this always been here?

Texts.Chs: 给她起一个浪漫的假名
Texts.Eng: Give her a romantic fake name

Texts.Chs: 他不会有一个约会的！
Texts.Eng: He can't get a date!

Texts.Chs: 他不存在！
Texts.Eng: He doesn't exist!
He loves a Hylotl!
His house is being foreclosed!
However, who instead greets me is a beautiful girl, dressed in strange ceremonial robes. Grasped in her hands is a pink staff.
Humped by a Deep One
I am not on fire, but that doesn't give me much reassurance. The place I am in is almost entirely unfamiliar.
I am on the shore of a small island, in the center of which is a grand pagoda. A sun sets above me. It is clear to me that I must plan my next move very carefully...
I ask her what she means.
I ask her why her ceremony wasn't complete.
I cannot tell if this beautiful girl is a genius or insane.
I collapse to the ground sobbing, next to the destroyed table. It was too real - Kasumi can't just be a dream, can she?
I could never destroy this Hockey table. Beautiful shrine maidens may come and go...
I cry out in a dramatic and wimpering rage. This Hockey table is nothing compared to love. In my anger, I attempt to flip the table, but my weak arms fail me.
I cry out in a dramatic and wimpering rage. This Hockey table is nothing compared to love. In my anger, I flip the table over, sending it crashing to the ground.
I figure that I may have upset her, and desperately think of a way to move the conversation forward.
I have a short time go gather my thoughts.
I have precious seconds left. I may fail at winning her love, but I must make an attempt! A BEAUTIFUL ATTEMPT!
I hear voices! I hide behind a nearby post. The architecture is all Hylotl, so at least my chances of being in Floran territory seems low.
I lift out the letter. Everything comes down to this.
I love you!
I never hear her reply, as time pulls me away into the dark void of nothingness once more.
I open the envelope, my heart racing. Perhaps the letter from Kasumi will instruct me how to return to her time so we can resume our fated love?
I panic and start yelling. I'm sure I will draw the attention of a helpful authority figure who will help me in my predicament.
I ponder my tribulations so far, but as I do so, Kasumi returns with a rolled up scroll.
I question if Kasumi has literally ever seen a duck, or even heard a second-hand description of one.
I quickly explain to Kasumi that in my era, the library is open.
I suddenly feel the crushing weight of how serious my circumstances have become.
I tersely avoid the subject of my name's embarassing origin.
I turn back to her. "Well?" she asks. "What do you think?"
I was sent through time!
I'm pretty sure no

I'm taking the first rover tomorrow morning, and leaving the second for the rest should I fail to return. At least then they can still escape. Now we just need to hope for some damned answers. I'm starting to lose it.
Is that it?
Is this a joke?
It's beautiful!
Jun 4 - Something in the ice
Jun 5 - Changes
Jun 6 - Confinement
Jun 9 - Tacos are nutritious
Just yelling at everyone!
Kasumi leaves for the beach, opening a chest of calligraphy brushes. I sit awkwardly on the steps of the pagoda entrance, watching her from a short distance.
Kasumi's poem echoes in my head, guiding me through the darkness. I feel like a fish on a lead. In the dark.

Texts.Chs: 麦克瑞迪最近变得有些奇怪。从那次解剖实验之后他就不一样了，这令我有些不安。
Texts.Eng: MacReady has been acting strange lately. I can't place my finger on it, but ever since that...thing...fell under his operating knife he's changed. It's unsettling.
My vision slowly returns to me, and I feel warm sand beneath my hands and feet. Am I on a planet's surface? Is that the sun I feel upon me, or perhaps I am merely on fire?
Never forget me!
No it's Air Hockey
Not really, no
Of course I've heard of it, it is a famous historical site, yet right now it hasn't even opened yet! THAT is why I knew I have been sent to the past!
Open the letter
Outside the entrance to the pagoda, I see a girl, kneeling in the sand. I gasp, unable to steel myself, and she turns to see me!
Paint?
Searching for gold!
She doesn't know what Air Hockey is.
She giggles. "No, silly, it's a duck!"
She ignores me entirely, contemplating for a moment before her face lights up.
She is taken aback by the abruptness of my statement. I panic, wondering why that would be one of the first things I would say to a girl.
She nods. "I have to come up with a song that will cleanse the land of uncivility. But I will need help coming up with ideas..."
She presents the scroll to me.
She replies, "Well I'm afraid you've come to the wrong place, because the Grand Hylotl Library isn't open to the public just yet."
She smiles, saying, "I am an artist. I must paint for the ritual!"
She thinks my name is Vaughn St. Lovecastle. If we are truly destined for one another, would she appreciate my true name? Could she ever?
Sneak around
So is the 'Tribute of song' next?

Texts.Chs: 某种狗?
Texts.Eng: Some sort of dog?
Starfish, in love!
Still on my knees, I eagerly peel away at the wax seal, careful not to tear the paper. Will this be a letter from Kasumi, confessing her love?

Texts.Chs: 告诉她你的名字
Texts.Eng: Tell her your name

Texts.Chs: 空气曲棍球之力
Texts.Eng: The Power of Air Hockey
The air is quiet, except for the soft lapping of waves on this mysterious beach. The ocean appears to be water, and not acid or magma. This fact calms me somewhat.

The driller fell through the damned ice! The entire thing is lost, utterly unsalvagable without some means to block the effects of the liquid nitrogen pool. And that still doesn't help lug the thing out.

Texts.Chs: 我眼前的一切彻底颠覆了我的认知。这个地方非常的古老，可能在还没有发明语言之前就已经存在了。
Texts.Eng: The find I have just made rewrites the knowledge of the cosmos in its entirety. There are ruins past the mountain. It was a treacherous climb but well worth it. This place is ancient beyond telling.

Texts.Chs: 噢，曲棍球台！我觉得我不应该谈论这个话题的，美丽的霞啊。我似乎看到命运已经快要把我遗弃了。
Texts.Eng: The hockey table... The present day... Kasumi! I feel like fate has been snatched from me.

Texts.Chs: 噢，这里是图书馆...鲛人的大塔图书馆！
Texts.Eng: The library... The Grand Hylotl Library!

Texts.Chs: 快来跳乡村舞蹈！
Texts.Eng: The village dance!

Texts.Chs: 在那个年代，或许连空气曲棍球都还没有。
Texts.Eng: There probably isn't even any Air Hockey IN this era.

Texts.Chs: 废墟中看到的雕像与我见过的物种完全不符合，所有物种应该有的特征在这些雕像上完全体现不出来。我感觉我的脑子快要裂开了。
Texts.Eng: These ruins match no known species, language or style I am aware of. Something about them is wrong, though. The angles are just...off. Dimensions seem larger or smaller than they should. My mind is cracking.

Texts.Chs: 去和美丽的女孩约会！
Texts.Eng: To meet beautiful girls!

Texts.Chs: 她或许非常美丽，并且是一位才华横溢的艺术家。不过这仅仅是我的幻想，不过我还是十分向往。
Texts.Eng: To think that not only is she beautiful, but that she is also a talented artist? Surely I must be in a dream, or perhaps an elaborate coma fantasy.

Texts.Chs: 今天我们发现了一条狗，准确的说，是一条狗的尸体。从它挣扎的痕迹看出，它是活生生的被吊起来然后被解剖的，而它的器官则在地板上整齐地罗列着，它就好像我交给麦克瑞迪的生物一样，完美地被解剖开了。
Texts.Eng: We found one of the dogs this morning. It had been strung up and vivisected. Its organs were in a neat pile beside it on the floor, stacked to resemble that malign aberration I found.

Texts.Chs: 我们在冰层中发现了一些尸体。我无法根据它们的外貌分辨出它到底是什么生物，因为我根本没有见过这样的物种。这太可怕了，不过我还是得把它们带给麦克瑞迪，或许在他对它们进行解剖后就能真相大白了。
Texts.Eng: We found some sort of corpse in the ice. I can't even discern what it is. Never seen anything like it. It's like a chimera of lifeforms. Terrifying to behold. I'm going to bring it to MacReady to autopsy.

Texts.Chs: 我们把麦克瑞迪关在了实验室里。这下他没法出来了！我应该去原先的那个山崖下方，看看到底是什么让麦克瑞迪变得如此...癫狂。
Texts.Eng: We've confined MacReady to the labs. He's totally lost it. At least we can seal the door remotely and he can be holed up with that...thing. I should investigate beyond the cliffs...see what is going on.

Texts.Chs: 你在画什么？
Texts.Eng: What did you paint?

Texts.Chs: 你想要做什么？
Texts.Eng: What do you need to do?

Texts.Chs: 这是什么？
Texts.Eng: What is it?

Texts.Chs: 这是什么天赋吗？
Texts.Eng: What is the talent?

Texts.Chs: 到底发生了什么？
Texts.Eng: What's going on?!

Texts.Chs: 我在哪儿？
Texts.Eng: Where am I?

Texts.Chs: 你是谁？
Texts.Eng: Who are you?

Texts.Chs: 崇高的仪式
Texts.Eng: Your ceremonial ritual

Texts.Chs: [...你继续翻阅着，接着你感觉这本湿漉漉的。在这本书的后面，字迹更加潦草，在仔细分辨字迹时，你发觉这字迹根本就是直接用手指沾着鲜血书写的，接下来的内容更让你坐立不安了。]
Texts.Eng: [...and then you find the juicy bits. Near the end of the book, scrawled in a more hasty hand (yes, they actually wrote on real live paper instead of digital!) a number of entries are found that are quite unsettling.]

Texts.Chs: [这本日志似乎是C.C.瓦格纳的。日志的封面满是斑驳的血迹，里面的内容大多数是一些日常记录，像是样本数据和一些气候实验等等内容。]
Texts.Eng: [This appears to be a journal, written by one C.C Wagner. The cover is blood-stained, ruining the once meticulously tidy book. Mostly, it's boring entries detailing nothing interesting. Sample data, climate experiments...]
